div.p: On June 13, 2019, the State Board of Education officially awarded Trinidad School District 1 for $15, 549,663 Building Excellent Schools Today (B.E.S.T.) grant for the middle school renovation project. The District also received a waiver for a 29% local match of $4,509,402. The only way to come up with the local match and access $11,040,260 FREE marijuana money is by passing a bond issue in November.

div.div: "Trinidad School District #1 will provide all students with a comprehensive system of support, a safe learning environment, and the opportunity to reach his/her academic and leadership potential as determined by state and national standards."

div.div: The Trinidad School District is comprised of four schools. Eckhart Elementary serves grades K and 1, Fisher’s Peak Elementary serves grades 2-5, Trinidad Middle School serves grades 6-8, and Trinidad High School serves grades 9-12. Our schools are committed to monitoring student progress, making decisions based…
